messages.messageBody:
On Wed, 5 Dec 2001 11:18:27 -0600 groundhoggirl
<groundhoggirl@...> writes:
> Thanks Sarah,
>
> Thanks for sharing this with us. I just got off the phone to make the

> arrangements for my twin boys. They are turning 8 on January 10th and
I
> think this would be a terrific birthday present.
>

Hey, that's my daughter's birthday - she'll be turning 9 :-)

I agree, it looks like a great thing, I'm just waiting until she wakes up
to make sure she'd want to do it - if not, maybe I could pass for 17 ;-)

Dar

messages.messageBody:
Thanks Sarah,

Thanks for sharing this with us. I just got off the phone to make the
arrangements for my twin boys. They are turning 8 on January 10th and I
think this would be a terrific birthday present.

Mimi

> I subscribe to a post-it list which offers ideas, etc. This came across

> FREE FLIGHT FOR KIDS
> If you have a child age 8-17, you can arrange for them to
> have a free demonstration flight on a plane (usually small
> personal prop planes). The Young Eagles Program is designed
> to introduce young people to aviation. The pilot will
> usually talk to the kids about the plane, aeronautical
> charts/reference points, preflight inspections, instrument
> panels, & the parts of the plane. While the flight is
> usually a one day event, there are also summer programs
> available at their headquarters. The flights can be found
> all over the country. For more info on scheduling a flight
> go to
> http://www.youngeagles.org
> or Email yeagles@..., or call (920)426-4831. What a
> great Christmas idea. POST IT...near your phone.
>

messages.subject: free flying info
messages.msgSnippet: I subscribe to a post-it list which offers ideas, etc. This came across and I thought some of you here might be interested in it. Sarah FREE FLIGHT FOR KIDS If
messages.messageBody:
I subscribe to a post-it list which offers ideas, etc. This came across and I thought some of you here might be interested in it. Sarah
FREE FLIGHT FOR KIDS
If you have a child age 8-17, you can arrange for them to
have a free demonstration flight on a plane (usually small
personal prop planes). The Young Eagles Program is designed
to introduce young people to aviation. The pilot will
usually talk to the kids about the plane, aeronautical
charts/reference points, preflight inspections, instrument
panels, & the parts of the plane. While the flight is
usually a one day event, there are also summer programs
available at their headquarters. The flights can be found
all over the country. For more info on scheduling a flight
go to
http://www.youngeagles.org
or Email yeagles@..., or call (920)426-4831. What a
great Christmas idea. POST IT...near your phone.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
